title: capesR
text: capesR package developed facilitate access manipulation data Catalog Theses Dissertations Brazilian Coordination Improvement Higher Education Personnel (CAPES). catalog includes information theses dissertations defended higher education institutions Brazil, variables : institution: Higher Education Institution. area: Academic field work. region state: Location research conducted. abstract: Brief description topic objectives. package automates process obtaining organizing data, making easily accessible analysis reporting. original CAPES data available dadosabertos.capes.gov.br. data used package hosted Open Science Framework (OSF).

title: capesR
text: install package, use:
code: devtools::install_github("hugoavmedeiros/capesR")

title: capesR
text: download_capes_data function allows download CAPES data files hosted OSF. can specify desired years, corresponding files saved locally.

title: capesR
text: Download data using temporary directory (function default): case, data persist future uses.
code: library(capesR) library(dplyr)  # Download data for 1987 and 1990 capes_files <- download_capes_data(c(1987, 1990))  # View the list of downloaded files capes_files %>% glimpse()

title: capesR
text: recommended define persistent directory store downloaded data instead using default temporary directory (tempdir()). allow reuse data future. using persistent directory, data downloaded . future uses, function identify files already exist directory return paths.
code: # Define the directory to store the data data_directory <- "/capes_data"  # Download data for 1987 and 1990 using a persistent directory capes_files <- download_capes_data(   c(1987, 1990),   destination = data_directory)

title: capesR
text: Use read_capes_data function combine downloaded files list generated download_capes_data function manually created.

title: capesR
code: # Combine all selected data without using filters combined_data <- read_capes_data(capes_files)  # View the combined data combined_data %>% glimpse()

what: Example 2 - Combining Data with Exact Filters
title: capesR
text: Filters applied data read, improving performance.
code: # Create an object with filters exact_filter <- list(   base_year = c(2021, 2022),   state = c("PE", "CE") )  # Combine filtered data filtered_data <- read_capes_data(capes_files, exact_filter)  # View the filtered data filtered_data %>% glimpse()

what: Example 3 - Combining Data with Text Filters
title: capesR
text: Exact filters applied reading data better performance, text filter optimized accelerate search.
code: # Create an object with filters text_filter <- list(   base_year = c(2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022),   state = c("PE", "CE"),   title = "education" )  # Combine filtered data text_filtered_data <- read_capes_data(capes_files, text_filter)  # View the filtered data text_filtered_data %>% glimpse()

title: capesR
text: search text already combined data, can use search_capes_text function, specifying term text field (e.g., title, abstract, author, advisor).

title: capesR
code: results <- search_capes_text(   data = combined_data,   term = "education",   field = "title" )

title: capesR
text: package also provides set synthetic data, capes_synthetic_df, containing aggregated information CAPES Catalog Theses Dissertations. synthetic dataset facilitates quick analyses prototyping without requiring full downloads processing.

title: capesR
text: synthetic data includes following columns: base_year: Reference year data. institution: Higher Education Institution. area: Area Concentration. program_name: Name Graduate Program. type: Type work (e.g., Master’s, Doctorate). region: Region Brazil. state: Federative Unit (state). n: Total number works.

title: capesR
text: synthetic data available directly package can loaded :
code: data(capes_synthetic_df)  # View the first rows of the data head(capes_synthetic_df)

title: capesR
text: can use synthetic data quick exploratory analyses charts:
code: # Load the data data(capes_synthetic_df)  # Example: Count by year and type of work library(dplyr) capes_synthetic_df %>%   group_by(base_year, type) %>%   summarise(total = sum(n)) %>%   arrange(desc(total))

title: capesR
text: tutorial presented basic steps use capesR package. information available functions, consult documentation :
code: ?years_osf ?capes_synthetic_df ?download_capes_data ?search_capes_text ?read_capes_data

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hugo Vasconcelos Medeiros. Author, maintainer. Dalson Figueiredo Filho. Author. André Leite. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vasconcelos Medeiros H, Figueiredo Filho D, Leite (2024). capesR: Access CAPES Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/hugoavmedeiros/capesR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {capesR: Access to CAPES Data},   author = {Hugo {Vasconcelos Medeiros} and Dalson {Figueiredo Filho} and André Leite},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/hugoavmedeiros/capesR}, }

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: capesR R package designed facilitate access manipulation data Catalog Theses Dissertations maintained Brazilian Coordination Improvement Higher Education Personnel (CAPES). catalog contains information theses dissertations defended higher education institutions (HEIs) Brazil. original CAPES data available dadosabertos.capes.gov.br. data used package available repository Open Science Framework (OSF).

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: can install package directly GitHub :
code: # Install capesR from CRAN install.packages('capesR')

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: download_capes_data function allows download CAPES data files hosted OSF. can specify desired years, corresponding files saved locally.

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: Download data using temporary directory (default): case, data persist future use.
code: library(capesR) library(dplyr)  # Download data for the years 1987 and 1990 capes_files <- download_capes_data(c(1987, 1990))  # View the list of downloaded files capes_files %>% glimpse()

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: recommended define persistent directory store downloaded data instead using default temporary directory (tempdir()). allows reuse data later. case, data downloaded . Future calls identify files already exist return paths.
code: # Define the directory where the data will be stored data_directory <- "/capes_data"  # Download data for 1987 and 1990 using a persistent directory capes_files <- download_capes_data(   c(1987, 1990),   destination = data_directory)

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: Use read_capes_data function combine downloaded files list generated download_capes_data manually created.

title: Access to CAPES Data
code: # Combine all selected data without filters combined_data <- read_capes_data(capes_files)  # View the combined data combined_data %>% glimpse()

what: Example 2 - Combine Data with Exact Filters
title: Access to CAPES Data
text: Filters applied reading data, improving performance.
code: # Create a filter object exact_filter <- list(   ano_base = c(2021, 2022),   uf = c("PE", "CE") )  # Combine filtered data filtered_data <- read_capes_data(capes_files, exact_filter)  # View the filtered data filtered_data %>% glimpse()

what: Example 3 - Combine Data with Text Filters
title: Access to CAPES Data
text: Exact filters applied reading performance, text filter optimized quick searches.
code: # Create a filter object text_filter <- list(   ano_base = c(2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022),   uf = c("PE", "CE"),   titulo = "Educação" )  # Combine filtered data text_filtered_data <- read_capes_data(capes_files, text_filter)  # View the filtered data text_filtered_data %>% glimpse()

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: search text already combined data, use search_capes_text function, specifying term text field (e.g., title, abstract, author, advisor).

title: Access to CAPES Data
code: results <- search_capes_text(   data = combined_data,   term = "Educação",   field = "titulo" )

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: package also provides set synthetic data, capes_synthetic_df, contains aggregated information CAPES Catalog Theses Dissertations. synthetic data simplify quick analyses prototyping without requiring full data downloads processing.

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: synthetic data includes following columns: base_year: Reference year data. institution: Higher Education Institution. area: Area Concentration. program_name: Graduate Program Name. type: Type work (e.g., Master’s, Doctorate). region: Region Brazil. state: Federative Unit (state). n: Total number works.

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: synthetic data available directly package can loaded :
code: data(capes_synthetic_df)  # View the first rows of the data head(capes_synthetic_df)

title: Access to CAPES Data
text: can use synthetic data quick exploratory analyses charts:
code: # Load the data data(capes_synthetic_df)  # Example: Count by year and type of work library(dplyr) capes_synthetic_df %>%   group_by(base_year, type) %>%   summarise(total = sum(n)) %>%   arrange(desc(total))

title: Synthetic CAPES Data — capes_synthetic_df
text: Aggregated data CAPES Catalog Theses Dissertations, containing summarized information year, institution, area, program, type, region, state (UF).

title: Synthetic CAPES Data — capes_synthetic_df
code: capes_synthetic_df

title: Synthetic CAPES Data — capes_synthetic_df
text: data frame following columns: base_year Reference year data. institution Higher Education Institution. area Area Concentration. program_name Name Graduate Program. type Type work (e.g., Master's, Doctorate). region Region Brazil. state Federative Unit (state). n Total number works.

title: Synthetic CAPES Data — capes_synthetic_df
text: Synthetic data created CAPES Catalog Theses Dissertations.

title: Synthetic CAPES Data — capes_synthetic_df
code: data(capes_synthetic_df) head(capes_synthetic_df) #> # A tibble: 6 × 8 #> # Groups:   base_year, institution, area, program_name, type, region [6] #>   base_year area         institution     n program_name region state type  #>       <dbl> <chr>        <chr>       <int> <chr>        <chr>  <chr> <chr> #> 1      1987 CIÊNCIA DA … (INATIVA) …     7 INFORMÁTICA  NORDE… PB    Mest… #> 2      1987 ECONOMIA     (INATIVA) …     4 ECONOMIA RU… NORDE… PB    Mest… #> 3      1987 ENGENHARIA … (INATIVA) …     8 ENGENHARIA … NORDE… PB    Mest… #> 4      1987 ENGENHARIA … (INATIVA) …     4 ENGENHARIA … NORDE… PB    Dout… #> 5      1987 ENGENHARIA … (INATIVA) …     5 ENGENHARIA … NORDE… PB    Mest… #> 6      1987 ENGENHARIA … (INATIVA) …     1 ENGENHARIA … NORDE… PB    Mest…

title: Download CAPES Data — download_capes_data
text: Downloads CAPES theses dissertations data files OSF selected years.

title: Download CAPES Data — download_capes_data
code: download_capes_data(years, destination = tempdir(), timeout = 120)  baixar_dados_capes(years, destination = tempdir(), timeout = 120)

title: Download CAPES Data — download_capes_data
text: years vector desired years. destination directory files saved (default: temporary directory). timeout timeout seconds download process (default: 120 seconds).

title: Download CAPES Data — download_capes_data
text: list file paths downloaded already existing files.

title: Download CAPES Data — download_capes_data
code: # \donttest{ # Download data for the years 1987 and 1990 capes_files <- download_capes_data(c(1987, 1990)) #> Downloading: C:\Users\HUGO~1.VAS\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpeqmqwL/capes_1987.parquet #> Downloading: C:\Users\HUGO~1.VAS\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpeqmqwL/capes_1990.parquet # }

what: Read and filter data from the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations — read_capes_data
title: Read and filter data from the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations — read_capes_data
text: function combines data multiple Parquet files applies optional filters, including text-based searches.

title: Read and filter data from the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations — read_capes_data
code: read_capes_data(files, filters = list())  ler_dados_capes(files, filters = list())

title: Read and filter data from the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations — read_capes_data
text: files vector list paths Parquet files. filters list filters apply (e.g., list(base_year = 1987, state = "SP", title = "education")).

title: Read and filter data from the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations — read_capes_data
text: `data.frame` containing combined filtered data.

title: Read and filter data from the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations — read_capes_data
code: # \donttest{ # Download data for the years 1987 and 1990 capes_files <- download_capes_data(c(1987, 1990)) #> File already exists: C:\Users\HUGO~1.VAS\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpeqmqwL/capes_1987.parquet #> File already exists: C:\Users\HUGO~1.VAS\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpeqmqwL/capes_1990.parquet # Combine all selected data combined_data <- read_capes_data(capes_files) # }

what: Search for terms in text fields of the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations data — search_capes_text
title: Search for terms in text fields of the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations data — search_capes_text
text: function allows searching specific terms text fields previously loaded `data.frame`.

title: Search for terms in text fields of the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations data — search_capes_text
code: search_capes_text(data, term, field)  buscar_texto_capes(data, term, field)

title: Search for terms in text fields of the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations data — search_capes_text
text: data `data.frame` containing CAPES Catalog Theses Dissertations data. term string, term search . field string, name field search (e.g., "resumo", "titulo").

title: Search for terms in text fields of the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations data — search_capes_text
text: `data.frame` rows matching search message indicating results found.

title: Search for terms in text fields of the CAPES Catalog of Theses and Dissertations data — search_capes_text
code: # \donttest{ # Download data for the years 1987 and 1990 capes_files <- download_capes_data(c(1987, 1990)) #> File already exists: C:\Users\HUGO~1.VAS\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpeqmqwL/capes_1987.parquet #> File already exists: C:\Users\HUGO~1.VAS\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpeqmqwL/capes_1990.parquet # Combine all selected data combined_data <- read_capes_data(capes_files) # Search data results <- search_capes_text( data = combined_data, term = "Educação",   field = "titulo" ) #> No results found for the search. # }
